alert.note: Alert for Richmond; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Richmond and central Westmoreland Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 230 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Montross, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Montross, Newland, Lerty, Currioman Landing, Singerly, Mount Holly, Peeds, Foneswood, Stratford Hall, Potomac Mills, Piney Grove, Westmoreland State and Templeman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
